info.title: Cisco Spaces Location Cloud API
info.description: The Cisco Spaces Location Cloud APIs provided by ApiServer for Map, Devices and History. The DNASpaces UI has three websites, please use the corresponding URL US(dnaspaces.io), EU(dnaspaces.eu) and Singapore(ciscospaces.sg) when calling the APIs. When the base url has version v2 present, then please exclude adding v2 in api URL

get.description: Get the location hierarchy. This hierarchy will have all levels included from root to floor and would not be like the legacy hierarchy of 3 levels (campus, buildings, floors).
Get floor details like parent location hierarchy, regions, maps, zones etc. for the floor id specified in API request.

parameters.name: floorId
parameters.description: floor id for the floor user wants to fetch data for

200.description: Floor details for given floor fetched successfully.

get.description: This API supports searching by a variety of parameters. If no parameters are given, all active devices are returned with pagination. The default page number is 1, default number of items per page is 1000.
Retrieve the active devices count. The API supports searching by a variety of parameters. If no parameters are given, the count of all active devices are returned.

200.description: The count for the active devices.

get.description: Gives a list of all the floors unique identifier which have devices.

200.description: The list of the floor unique id and the total number of the devices.

get.description:
Exports client's history records to a file "history_dump.csv". This API returns maximum of 50,000 records. If startTime and endTime is not given, then default time range is the last 24 hours. If the no.of records is more than 50,000 API gives error mentioning to reduce the time range which can be done using startTime and endTime query params. Also, the time range is 1 day at most. Device type INTERFERER and ROGUE_AP are not supported. 
**Supported Columns are** 
tenantid,macaddress,devicetype,campusid,buildingid,floorid,floorhierarchy,coordinatex,coordinatey,sourcetimestamp,manufacturer,associated,ssid,username,associatedapmac,computetype,sourcetype,hierarchy_id,ipaddress. 
**Non supported Columns w.r.t V1 History are** 
maxdetectedapmac,maxdetectedband,detectingcontrollers,firstactiveat,locatedsinceactivecount,changedon,maxdetectedrssi,associatedaprssi,maxdetectedslot,staticdevice,machashed,policyname,udid,recordtype

200.description: Successfully retrieve the client history within the given time range.

get.description:
Exports client's history records in gzipped format. This API returns maximum of 5million records. If startTime and endTime is not given, then default time range is the last 24 hours. If the no.of records is more than 5million, API gives error mentioning to reduce the time range which can be done using startTime and endTime query params. Also, the time range is 1 day at most. Note: The API takes time(up to 2mins) because of the large data amount, please be patient. Device type INTERFERER and ROGUE_AP are not supported. 
**Supported Columns are** 
tenantid,macaddress,devicetype,campusid,buildingid,floorid,floorhierarchy,coordinatex,coordinatey,sourcetimestamp,manufacturer,associated,ssid,username,associatedapmac,computetype,sourcetype,hierarchy_id,ipaddress. 
**Non supported Columns w.r.t V1 History are** 
maxdetectedapmac,maxdetectedband,detectingcontrollers,firstactiveat,locatedsinceactivecount,changedon,maxdetectedrssi,associatedaprssi,maxdetectedslot,staticdevice,machashed,policyname,udid,recordtype

200.description: Successfully retrieve the client history within the given time range.

get.description: Gives the count of history records in given time range. If startTime and endTime is not given, then the default time range is the last 24 hours. Also, the time range is 1 day at most. Device type INTERFERER and ROGUE_AP are not supported.

200.description: Client history record count in the given time range

get.description: Get the list of clients macAddress. If startTime and endTime are not given, all the clients mac addresses in the last 1 day will be returned. Device type INTERFERER and ROGUE_AP are not supported.

200.description: A list of the client mac address.

get.description: Get the given device's history details. The pagination is provided. If startTime and endTime is not given, then the default time range is the last 24 hours. Also, the time range is 1 day at most. Device type INTERFERER and ROGUE_AP are not supported.

name.description: Access point name either queried from controller or defined in maps

displayName.description: Access point display name defined in maps

radioMacAddress.description: Access point base radio MAC address

ethMacAddress.description: Access point ethernet MAC address queried from controller

ipAddress.description: Access point IP address queried from controller

apMode.description: Access point mode, currently not populated

switchName.description: Controller IP address that the access point is associated with

floorId.description: ID of the floor that the access point is placed on

floorIdString.description: ID of the floor that the access point is placed on

floorName.description: Name of the floor that the access point is placed on defined in maps

angle.description: Angle of the access point defined in map

numOfSlots.description: Number of slots of the access point defined in map

x.description: X coordinate of the access point

y.description: Y coordinate of the access point

z.description: Z coordinate of the access point

geoCoordinate.description: only computed when there are valid GPS markers on the floor

level.description: The level in the map hierarchy.
The item's parent level in the hierarchy.

id.description: The child of the current element's unique identifier.

name.description: The name of this child element.

level.description: The level of the hierarchy of this child element.

createdOn.description: The date the child element is created.

validImageSupplied.description: Indicate if the source image is valid(true) or not(false).

createdOn.description: The date and time of the level being created.

id.description: Location hierarchy id for the map element. Map element can be root, organization, group, cmx, meraki, campus, building, network, floor.

parentId.description: Parent Id of parent location of current location type. Defaulted to -1 for root level as root is on top of hierarchy.

inferredLocationTypes.description: Location type in the hierarchy. This can be root, organization, group, cmx, meraki, campus, building, network, floor.

totalAreaUnit.description: Total area unit for location type

geoLocation.description: Location coordinates of latitude and longitude.

locationPath.description: Location IDs of child location entities

childCount.description: Number of child location entities under current location.

hierarchyMapSources.description: Array of hierarchy map sources. Possible values are CMX, PRIME, DNAC.

children.description: children location to given parent hierarchy

children.description: children location to given parent hierarchy

createdOn.description: The date and time of the level being created.

type.description: Indicate how to handle the vertices on map.

deviceType.example: Represents type of a device. Possible types are CLIENT, TAG, BLE_TAG, ROGUE_AP, ROGUE_CLIENT and INTERFERER.

campusId.example: Represents campus where device is located.

floorId.example: Represents floor where device is located.

floorHierarchy.example: Hierarchy of the device starting from campus, building, floor and zone. We support single zone in the hierarchy when the device is detected in multiple zones.

sourcetimestamp.example: Timestamp when the device is processed by Location Engine. For e.g. when the location is computed.

maxdetectedapmac.example: Represents AP mac which provides max RSSI in the RSSI probe packet.

maxdetectedband.example: Represents AP band which provides max RSSI in the RSSI probe packet.

firstactiveat.example: When this device is first seen active in the network.

locatedsinceactivecount.example: This refers to how many times this device has location computed after its active.

associated.example: Represents IEEE 802.11 packet status, applicable for Clients when they connect to WIFI network.

maxdetectedrssi.example: Represents max RSSI in the RSSI probe packet.

ssid.example: Represents wireless network device is connected to.

username.example: Represents device username used for connecting to SSID.

associatedapmac.example: Represents device associated AP after connecting to SSID.

associatedaprssi.example: Represents associated AP RSSI in the probe packet.

maxdetectedslot.example: Represents max RSSI is reported from which AP slot.

staticdevice.example: Represents whether device is marked as static device.

computetype.example: Represents device location done on which dataset. Possible values are: 1.RSSI (1) - RSSI probe packets are reported by non-fast locate aps on NMSP channel  2.FASTLOCATE-RSSI (2) - Fast locate enabled Aps have contributed to send RSSI probe packets on UDP channel  3.AoA (3) - Reported Hyperlocation data  4. Associated-AP (8) - When device location is done using Associated AP location on the map

source.example: Represents device location is done on Cloud or CMX tethered. Possible values are: 1. Compute (1) - for cloud location  2. Notification (2) - for cmx tethered  3. Meraki (3)  - for Meraki devices

machashed.example: Represents whether the device mac is hashed from Connector.

sourceTimestamp.description: The UTC timestamp of the client source.

items.description: The coordinates represents cartesian location (x,y) of device which is always relative to a given floor

associated.description: The client is associated to AP or not. True means yes, false otherwise.

sent.description: The total sent messages in last 24 hours

acknowledge.description: The total acknowledged messages in last 24 hours

enabled.description: The notification is enabled or not

success.description: operation status. true means successful, false otherwise.

count.description: The total number of associated devices on this floor

total.description: The client count based on the give query strings.

tenantId.description: The tenantId of the current tenant

coordinates.description: The coordinates represents cartesian location (x,y) of device which is always relative to a given floor

campusId.description: unique identifier for a campus from the map import process

buildingId.description: unique identifier for a building from the map import process

floorId.description: unique identifier for a floor from the map import process\

coordinates.description: The coordinates represents cartesian location (x,y) of device which is always relative to a given floor

rawCoordinates.description: The raw x and y coordinates of a device.

computeType.description: The compute type, possible values are RSSI and AOA.

firstLocatedAt.description: The first time of the device location being detected.

lastLocationAt.description: The last time of the location being detected.

changedOn.description: The UTC time the device state changed.

associated.description: true|false.  Whether or not a device has connected to a network.

deviceType.description: CLIENT, TAG, ROGUE_AP, ROGUE_CLIENT, INTERFERER AND BLE_TAG

campusId.description: unique identifier for a campus from the map import process

buildingId.description: unique identifier for a building from the map import process

floorId.description: unique identifier for a floor from the map import process

lhfloorId.description: location hierarchy unique identifier for a floor from the map import process

hierarchy.description: Location hierarchy displayed in string format

locationHierarchy.description: Location hierarchy from root level displayed in string format

hierarchyIds.description: array of hierarchy level ids from root to floor or zone

source.description: Device source like Meraki (data from Meraki Cloud), Notification (tethered data from CMX) and Compute (data from Connector)

isMacHashed.description: states where the mac address is hash value

deviceId.description: Unique device id assigned to device on Controller. Mainly used for randomised devices. When there is no unique device id available, Mac address is populated.

coordinates.description: The coordinates represents cartesian location (x,y) of device which is always relative to a given floor

geoCoordinates.description: Latitude and Longitude coordinates of a device.

confidenceFactor.description: With every calculated location (x,y) a confidence factor (error feet) is returned.

computeType.description: The compute type, possible values are RSSI, FASTLOCATE-RSSI and AOA.

firstLocatedAt.description: The first time of the device location being detected.

lastLocatedAt.description: The last time of the location being detected.

changedOn.description: The UTC time the device state changed.

associated.description: true|false.  Whether or not a device has connected to a network.

bands.description: The wifi band the AP supports.

band.description: The WiFi band the device is in.

rssi.description: Wifi service set identifier. Available for associated clients only.

results.description: The list of device location data, include associated AP devices location data as the first item and each device's mac address and coordinates as following items in the list. (As "oneof" schema is not supported in current version of swagger editor(2.0), please refer to model "LocationDeviceDetails" for schema reference as well)

morePage.description: True to indicate there is next page, false otherwise

deviceTypeParam.name: deviceType
deviceTypeParam.description: CLIENT, TAG, BLE, ROGUE_AP, ROGUE_CLIENT or INTERFERER

deviceIdParam.name: deviceId
deviceIdParam.description: The device unique identifier, for example the device macAddress.

floorIdParam.name: floorId
floorIdParam.description: Unique identifier for a floor from the map import process

buildingIdParam.name: buildingId
buildingIdParam.description: Unique identifier for a building from the map import process

campusIdParam.name: campusId
campusIdParam.description: Unique identifier for a campus from the map import process

associatedParam.name: associated
associatedParam.description: true|false.  Whether or not a device has connected to a network.

ssidParam.name: ssid
ssidParam.description: Wifi service set identifier (SSID).  Available for associated clients only.

v2ssidParam.name: ssid
v2ssidParam.description: Wifi service set identifier (SSID).  Available for associated devices only.

apMacAddressParam.name: apMacAddress
apMacAddressParam.description: The mac address of the Access Point (AP).  Available for associated clients only.

v2apMacAddressParam.name: apMacAddress
v2apMacAddressParam.description: The mac address of the Access Point (AP).  Available for associated devices only.

usernameParam.name: username
usernameParam.description: user name of the connected user.  Available for associated clients only.

v2usernameParam.name: username
v2usernameParam.description: user name of the connected user.  Available for associated devices only.

ipAddressParam.name: ipAddress
ipAddressParam.description: IP address of the connected device.  Available for associated clients only.

v2ipAddressParam.name: ipAddress
v2ipAddressParam.description: IP address of the connected device.  Available for associated devices only.

rogueApClientsParam.name: rogueApClients
rogueApClientsParam.description: When using deviceType=ROGUE_AP, this will return rogue APs that have connected clients.

v2rogueApClientsParam.name: rogueApClients
v2rogueApClientsParam.description: When using deviceType=ROGUE_AP, this will return rogue APs that have connected devices.

groupByParam.name: groupBy
groupByParam.description: Used to get count breakdowns by floorId, buildingId, campusId, ssid, apMacAddress, associated, deviceType.

radiusParam.name: radius
radiusParam.description: The radius, it should go with x and y.

xParam.name: x
xParam.description: The x coordinate of the radius center.

yParam.name: y
yParam.description: The y coordinate of the radius center.

startTime.name: startTime
startTime.description: The start time of the range in UTC time format (epoch).

endTime.name: endTime
endTime.description: The end time of the range in UTC time format (epoch)

format.name: format
format.description: Indicate if using geojson, value is "geojson" if so.

timeZone.name: timeZone
timeZone.description:
History records are returned as per the requested timeZone. This can be a decimal number with sign (positive or negative). Default value is 0 indicating no timeZone adjustments required. See below examples:
When the timeZone is passed as 5.5 (IST) this will return records (UTC + 5.5) time range.
When the timeZone is passed as -7 (PDT) this will return records (UTC – 7) time range.

includeDetailsParam.name: includeDetails
includeDetailsParam.description: true|false - Includes other details like floorId, sourceTimestamp, coordinates, associated, associatedApmac in the API response

historyLimitParam.name: limit
historyLimitParam.description: The maximum number of items that may be returned in a single request. Should be between 1 and 50000. Default value is 50000.

mapElementIdParam.name: mapElementId
mapElementIdParam.description: Indicate the map element unique identifier.

mapElementLevelParam.name: mapElementLevel
mapElementLevelParam.description: Indicate the map element level, valid value is "campus", "building" and "floor".

pageParam.name: page
pageParam.description: The page number requests for. Start from 1 and default value is 1.

v2limitParam.name: limit
v2limitParam.description: The maximum number of items that may be returned for a single request. Default value is 1000. Other allowed values are from 1000 to 20K. Anything above 20k is sent will be converted to 10k limit.

sortParam.name: sort
sortParam.description: The sorting methods for the clients in the response, asc or desc.

sampleRateParam.name: sampleRate
sampleRateParam.description: The sampleRate of the notification statistics. The unit is in seconds, default is 300s.

deviceIdPathParam.name: deviceId
deviceIdPathParam.description: The device unique identifier, for example the device macAddress.

apStatusParam.name: status
apStatusParam.description: The access points status, valid status is missing.

apCountStatusParam.name: status
apCountStatusParam.description: The access points status, valid status is missing, active, inactive, all.

searchTypeParam.name: searchType
searchTypeParam.description: Indicate if exact match is required. Valid value is "wildcard"

scrollIdParam.name: searchType
scrollIdParam.description: Query next page of data using scroll id present in previous api response
